NoteLiteral.En:
Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card/passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol for the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page). 
B2 level of English language proficiency is required.

Description.En:
This micro-module addresses the critical role of stakeholder engagement in project management. It explores how to identify, prioritize, and effectively engage stakeholders to ensure project success. The module aims to equip you with the skills to handle stakeholder dynamics, enhance communication, and manage conflicts, ultimately fostering a collaborative project environment. 

Key Areas of Focus: 

- Understanding the concept of project stakeholders and their influence.

- Developing and applying stakeholder engagement strategies.

- Techniques for managing difficult stakeholders and conflicts.

This module will equip you with the skills to identify and analyse project stakeholders, as well as to communicate effectively and manage conflicts, making you a valuable asset in any project management team. You'll gain hands-on experience through various learning activities, including video lectures, readings, and interactive tasks.

Title.En: Understand project stakeholders and apply techniques for their analysis

NoteLiteral.En: Having completed course, the student should be able to define the concept of project stakeholders, and various techniques to analyse their interests and influence over the project.
Having completed the course, the student should be able to apply project stakeholder engagement strategies.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
The expected workload of the micro-module is around 14 hours per week. This includes time invested in watching the video lectures, reading, preparation for quiz, assignment writing and self-reflection.  

Teaching and working methods: The micro-module utilizes digital teaching methods and applications which include video lectures, interviews with business representatives, quizzes, case analysis, assignment writings. 

Examination: The micro-module is examined by two mini quizzes, two written assignments and assessment of activity level in the discussion forums.  

[Syllabus of the micro-module](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=MM00M116&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=)
Mastering stakeholder engagement for project success

This micro-module aims to provide you with the critical skills and knowledge to effectively engage and manage project stakeholders. You will learn to identify key stakeholders, understand their needs and expectations, and develop strategies for communication and collaboration. The most important aspect of this module is empowering you to foster strong relationships and drive project success through effective stakeholder management. By the end, you'll be equipped to handle stakeholder dynamics confidently, ensuring your projects meet their goals and deliver value to all involved.

Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card/passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol for the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page). 

B2 level of English language proficiency is required.
